subject: Re: [junit] Re: Individual tests ok, problem in a suite
msgSnippet: ... I don t know about that... consider the case of IBM s EJB/access bean implementation! http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?AbstractTestCases My lesson: If you can t
messageBody:
Cedric Beust wrote:
> > From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
>
> > The lesson here is to restrict variable declarations to the
> > smallest scope that you can get away with.
>
> The other lesson is: if you think you found a bug in HashMap, you are most
> likely wrong :-)
>
> (which is a variant of the older saying: the bug is always in your code,
> never in the compiler)

I don't know about that... consider the case of IBM's EJB/access bean
implementation!

http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?AbstractTestCases

My lesson: If you can't figure out why the test failed, write a smaller
test.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
